summaryText: Wow, what an incredible message from Pastor Travis Hearn about waiting on God's promises! Pastor Travis takes us on a powerful journey through the biblical story of Abraham and Sarah, revealing how God's promises often seem impossible, absurd, and take far longer than we expect. Can you imagine waiting 25 years for a promise to be fulfilled? PT reminds us that God's timing is perfect, and we must resist the temptation to settle, compromise, or lose hope during the waiting season. Sometimes God's best looks completely ridiculous in the natural realm - and that's exactly where faith comes in! The sermon challenges us to trust God's process, even when it doesn't make sense. Pastor Travis powerfully illustrates how compromise can have generational consequences, using the story of Ishmael as a profound example of what happens when we try to 'help' God fulfill His promises. The most powerful takeaway? God is always on time, never early, and His promises are worth waiting for. As PT says, 'Never trade a moment of pleasure for a lifetime of pain.'
mainPoints: Don't settle for less than God's best
Don't compromise your calling or character
Don't lose hope during the waiting process

versesMentioned.text: For I know the plans I have for you,' declares the Lord, 'plans to prosper you and not to harm you, plans to give you hope and a future.'

All the land that you see I will give to you and your offspring forever. I will make your offspring like the dust of the earth, so that if anyone can count the dust, then your offspring can be counted.
Abraham fell facedown; he laughed and said to himself, 'Will a son be born to a man a hundred years old? Will Sarah bear a child at the age of ninety?'
Jesus looked at them and said, 'With man this is impossible, but with God all things are possible.'
Let us not become weary in doing good, for at the proper time we will reap a harvest if we do not give up.

When you pass through the waters, I will be with you; and when you pass through the rivers, they will not sweep over you. When you walk through the fire, you will not be burned; the flames will not set you ablaze.
A longing fulfilled is sweet to the soul, but fools detest turning from evil.
For the revelation awaits an appointed time; it speaks of the end and will not prove false. Though it linger, wait for it; it will certainly come and will not delay.

Monday.scripture: Psalm 37:7: 'Be still before the Lord and wait patiently for him; do not fret when people succeed in their ways, or when they carry out their wicked schemes.'
Monday.action: Create a 'promise journal' where you document God's promises in your life. Reflect on past promises God has fulfilled and write down current promises you're believing for.
Monday.prayer: Lord, teach me patience. Help me trust Your timing and Your process. Give me the strength to wait on Your promises without compromising or settling. Amen.

Tuesday.scripture: Isaiah 40:31: 'But those who hope in the Lord will renew their strength. They will soar on wings like eagles; they will run and not grow weary, they will walk and not be faint.'
Tuesday.action: Make a list of areas in your life where you're tempted to settle or compromise. Pray over each area, recommitting to God's highest standard.
Tuesday.prayer: Heavenly Father, renew my hope and strength. Help me resist the temptation to settle for less than Your best. Give me courage to wait on Your promises. Amen.

Wednesday.scripture: Philippians 3:14: 'I press on toward the goal to win the prize for which God has called me heavenward in Christ Jesus.'
Wednesday.focus: Maintaining spiritual focus during waiting periods
Wednesday.action: Fast from social media or entertainment for half a day. Use that time to seek God and reflect on His promises for your life.
Wednesday.prayer: Lord, help me keep my eyes fixed on You. Remove distractions and help me stay focused on Your plan and purpose. Strengthen my faith during this waiting season. Amen.

Thursday.scripture: James 1:4: 'Let perseverance finish its work so that you may be mature and complete, not lacking anything.'
Thursday.action: Journal about a past season of waiting. How did God grow and mature you during that time? What did you learn?
Thursday.prayer: God, help me see waiting as a season of growth, not punishment. Teach me to trust Your process and find joy in becoming more like You. Amen.

Friday.scripture: Romans 8:28: 'And we know that in all things God works for the good of those who love him, who have been called according to his purpose.'
Friday.focus: Trusting God's plan in all circumstances
Friday.action: Identify one area of your life where you're tempted to take control. Intentionally surrender that area to God through prayer and reflection.
Friday.prayer: Heavenly Father, I trust Your plan. Help me surrender my desires and timelines to Your perfect will. Give me peace and patience as I wait on You. Amen.

Saturday.scripture: Psalm 27:14: 'Wait for the Lord; be strong and take heart and wait for the Lord.'
Saturday.action: Spend time in extended worship and prayer. Ask God to reveal any areas where you've settled or compromised, and recommit those areas to Him.
Saturday.prayer: Lord, strengthen my faith. Help me wait on Your promises with joy and expectation. Remove any spirit of compromise and help me trust Your perfect timing. Amen.
